page.title: 06Government in the Wolfords
page.content: Great Wolford has a parish Council of five members, which meets 6 times per year. Little Wolford has a parish Meeting of which all local government electors are members and which meets twice a year. Both villages are in the Compton ward of the Stratford-on-Avon District Council with a total of 1,270 electors. They are also in the Shipston-on-Stour division of the Warwickshire County Council with 6,900 electors. They both elect two members each to serve as Trustees of the Wolford Charities, the fifth trustee being the Vicar of Wolford. Todenham has a Parish Council of 5 members which meets 4 times per year. It is in the Fossebridge Ward of the Cotswold District Council which has 1,088 electors and in the Moreton-in-Marsh division of the Gloucestershire County Council which has 5,770 electors.
